definitions.definition: To cause to become completely impregnated, or soaked (especially with a liquid).
definitions.example: After walking home in the driving rain, his clothes were saturated.
Modern television is saturated with violence.

definitions.definition: To satisfy the affinity of; to cause a substance to become inert by chemical combination with all that it can hold.
definitions.example: One can saturate phosphorus with chlorine.

definitions.definition: To render pure, or of a colour free from white light.
Full; unable to hold or contain any more.
(of a solution) Containing all the solute that can normally be dissolved at a given temperature.
Having all available valence bonds filled; especially of any organic compound containing only single bonds between carbon atoms.
(color) Having a high level of saturation.
